summary: This is a government letter motion filed under seal in the case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) by an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. It appears to be a procedural filing requesting temporary sealing of the document.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the document title (US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The government attorney from the Southern District of New York who submitted the letter motion under seal.

connections.description: The Assistant United States Attorney is prosecuting the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Government files sealed motion
events.description: The government submits a letter motion under seal in the case United States v. Maxwell.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: The federal judicial district where the case is being prosecuted.

locations.name: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: The address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, from where the filing was submitted.

keyFacts: The document is a government letter motion filed under seal in the criminal case against Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The motion was submitted by an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York on November 19, 2021.
The filing address is 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007, which is the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
